member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.SiteSummarySlashSyndicationExtension
member.summary: Extends syndication specifications to provide a means of describing Slash-based site meta-data.

remarks.para: The extends syndicated content to specify meta-data specific to Slash-based sites. This syndication extension conforms to the RDF Site Summary 1.0 Modules: Slash 1.0 specification, which can be found at http://web.resource.org/rss/1.0/modules/slash/.

code.title: The following code example demonstrates the usage of the SiteSummarySlashSyndicationExtension class.

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.SyndicationExtension
member.summary: Provides the set of methods, properties and events that web content syndication extensions should inherit from.

remarks.para: The abstract class is provided to reduce the difficulty of implementing custom syndication extensions. While implementers are free to implement their custom syndication extensions by implementing the interface, it is recommended that custom syndication extensions inherit from the base class.

If you choose to not inherit from the abstract base class, please be aware that the class internally calls the method, and so any custom syndication extension will need to have the appropriate and attributes applied as necessary.

code.title: The following code example demonstrates the usage of the SyndicationExtension abstract base class.

member.name: M:Argotic.Extensions.SyndicationExtension.GetSchema
member.summary: This method is reserved and should not be used. When implementing the interface, it is recommended that a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) is returned from this method, and instead, if specifying a custom schema is required, to apply the to the class.
member.returns: A object that represents an in-memory representation of an XML Schema as specified in the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) XML Schema Structures and Datatypes specifications. The default return value for this method is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

remarks.para: When serializing or deserializing an object, the class does not perform XML validation. For this reason, it is often safe to omit schema information by providing a trivial implementation of this method, for example by returning a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Some .NET Framework types as well as legacy custom types implementing the interface may be using instead of . In this case, the method returns an accurate XML schema that describes the XML representation of the object generated by the method.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.FeedSynchronizationSharingInformation.ExpiresOn
member.summary: Gets or sets the publisher suggested date-time subscribers should read the feed in order to avoid missing item updates.
member.value: A that represents the publisher suggested date-time before which subscribers should read the feed in order to avoid missing item updates. The default value is , which indicates that no expiration date was specified.

remarks.para: The value for this attribute should be interpreted as a best effort, uncalibrated value.
The value should be provided in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.FeedSynchronizationSharingInformation.Relations
member.summary: Gets the related feeds or locations.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent the related feeds or locations. The default value is an empty collection.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.FeedSynchronizationSharingInformation.Since
member.summary: Gets or sets a lower bound of items contained within the feed.
member.value: A lower bound of items contained within the feed.

remarks.para: If this property is defined, the property must also be specified.

Publishers will generally include, in a feed, only the most recent modifications, additions, and deletions within some reasonable time window. These feeds are referred to as partial feeds, whereas feeds containing the complete set of items are referred to as complete feeds.

In the feed sharing context new subscribers, or existing subscribers failing to subscribe within the published feed window, will need to initially copy a complete set of items from a publisher before being in a position to process incremental updates. As such, the specification provides for the ability for the latter feed to reference the complete feed.
Subscribers may optionally use the since and until properties of to ensure that all item updates are synchronized, even if the publisher periodically purges items from its feed.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.FeedSynchronizationSharingInformation.Until
member.summary: Gets or sets an upper bound of items contained within the feed.
member.value: An upper bound of items contained within the feed.

remarks.para: If this property is defined, the property must also be specified.

Publishers will generally include, in a feed, only the most recent modifications, additions, and deletions within some reasonable time window. These feeds are referred to as partial feeds, whereas feeds containing the complete set of items are referred to as complete feeds.

In the feed sharing context new subscribers, or existing subscribers failing to subscribe within the published feed window, will need to initially copy a complete set of items from a publisher before being in a position to process incremental updates. As such, the specification provides for the ability for the latter feed to reference the complete feed.
Subscribers may optionally use the since and until properties of to ensure that all item updates are synchronized, even if the publisher periodically purges items from its feed.

member.remarks: When a feed that contains this element updates, it pings a server that updates this file. The presence of this element indicates to aggregators that they only have to read the changes file to see if this feed has updated. If several feeds point to the same changes file, aggregators have to do less polling, resulting in better use of server bandwidth and faster scans. See http://www.xmlrpc.com/weblogsComForRss for technical details.

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreTypeVocabularies
member.summary: Represents a general, cross-domain list of approved terms that may be used as values when identifying the nature or genre of a resource.
member.remarks: For more information about the DCMI Type Vocabulary, see http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-type-vocabulary/.

member.name: F:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreTypeVocabularies.None
member.summary: No type vocabulary specified.

member.name: F:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreTypeVocabularies.Collection
member.summary: The type represents an aggregation of resources.
member.remarks: A collection is described as a group; its parts may also be separately described.

member.name: F:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreTypeVocabularies.DataSet
member.summary: The type represents data encoded in a defined structure.
member.remarks: Examples include lists, tables, and databases. A dataset may be useful for direct machine processing.

member.name: F:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreTypeVocabularies.Event
member.summary: The type represents a non-persistent, time-based occurrence.
member.remarks: Metadata for an event provides descriptive information that is the basis for discovery of the purpose, location, duration, and responsible agents associated with an event. Examples include an exhibition, webcast, conference, workshop, open day, performance, battle, trial, wedding, tea party, conflagration.

member.name: F:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreTypeVocabularies.Image
member.summary: The type represents a visual representation other than text.
member.remarks: Examples include images and photographs of physical objects, paintings, prints, drawings, other images and graphics, animations and moving pictures, film, diagrams, maps, musical notation. Note that may include both electronic and physical representations.

member.name: F:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreTypeVocabularies.InteractiveResource
member.summary: The type represents a resource requiring interaction from the user to be understood, executed, or experienced.
member.remarks: Examples include forms on Web pages, applets, multimedia learning objects, chat services, or virtual reality environments.

member.name: F:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreTypeVocabularies.MovingImage
member.summary: The type represents a series of visual representations imparting an impression of motion when shown in succession.
member.remarks: Examples include animations, movies, television programs, videos, zoetropes, or visual output from a simulation. Instances of the type Moving Image must also be describable as instances of the broader type .

member.name: F:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreTypeVocabularies.PhysicalObject
member.summary: The type represents an inanimate, three-dimensional object or substance.
member.remarks: Note that digital representations of, or surrogates for, these objects should use , or one of the other types.

member.name: F:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreTypeVocabularies.Service
member.summary: The type represents a system that provides one or more functions.
member.remarks: Examples include a photocopying service, a banking service, an authentication service, interlibrary loans, a Z39.50 or Web server.

member.name: F:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreTypeVocabularies.Software
member.summary: The type represents a computer program in source or compiled form.
member.remarks: Examples include a C source file, Microsoft Windows executable, or Perl script.

member.name: F:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreTypeVocabularies.Sound
member.summary: The type represents a resource primarily intended to be heard.
member.remarks: Examples include a music playback file format, an audio compact disc, and recorded speech or sounds.

member.name: F:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreTypeVocabularies.StillImage
member.summary: The type represents a static visual representation.
member.remarks: Examples include paintings, drawings, graphic designs, plans and maps. Recommended best practice is to assign the type to images of textual materials. Instances of the type Still Image must also be describable as instances of the broader type .

member.name: F:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreTypeVocabularies.Text
member.summary: The type represents a resource consisting primarily of words for reading.
member.remarks: Examples include books, letters, dissertations, poems, newspapers, articles, archives of mailing lists. Note that facsimiles or images of texts are still of the genre .

remarks.para: The extends syndicated content to specify all metadata terms maintained by the Dublin Core Metadata Initiative. This syndication extension conforms to the Dublin Core Metadata Initiative (DCMI) Metadata Terms 1.0 specification, which can be found at http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/.

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.SiteSummaryUpdateSyndicationExtension
member.summary: Extends syndication specifications to provide syndication hints to aggregators and other entities regarding how often a feed is updated.

remarks.para: The extends syndicated content to specify hints to aggregators and other entities regarding how often a feed is updated. This syndication extension conforms to the RDF Site Summary 1.0 Modules: Syndication 1.0 specification, which can be found at http://web.resource.org/rss/1.0/modules/syndication/.

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.SimpleListGroup
member.summary: Represents information that informs the client that the property to which it refers is one that is groupable, meaning that the client should provide a user interface that allows the user to group or filter on the values of that property.

remarks.para: This informational entity makes reference to XML elements that are child-elements within the items of the same feed, using the supported extension mechanism of the feed format. Groupable properties should contain a small set of discrete values.

The value which is to be grouped must be the text content of the element itself (i.e. the character data contained in the element). Values of attributes or nested elements cannot be used for grouping. The property referred to must have no child-elements. In general, only one instance of a property should appear in each item. Clients are free to ignore repeated instances of properties.

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaText
member.summary: Represents a means of allowing the inclusion of a text transcript, closed captioning, or lyrics of the media content.

remarks.para: Many of these objects are permitted to provide a time series of text. In such cases, it is encouraged, but not required, that the objects be grouped by language and appear in time sequence order based on the start time. objects can have overlapping start and end times.

member.summary: Encapsulates specific information about an individual .

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.IYahooMediaCommonObjectEntities
member.summary: Allows an object to implement common Yahoo media entities by representing a set of properties, methods, indexers and events common to Yahoo media syndication resources.

remarks.para: The following properties are optional and may appear as sub-elements of syndication entities, and/or .

When a property appears at a shallow level, such as syndication entities, it means that the property should be applied to every media object within its scope. Duplicated properties appearing at deeper levels of the document tree have higher priority over other levels. For example, level properties are favored over syndication entity level properties.
The priority level is listed from strongest to weakest: , , syndication item entity, syndication feed.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.IYahooMediaCommonObjectEntities.Categories
member.summary: Gets a taxonomy that gives an indication of the type of content for the media object.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent a taxonomy that gives an indication to the type of content for the media object. The default value is an empty collection.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.IYahooMediaCommonObjectEntities.Copyright
member.summary: Gets or sets the copyright information for the media object.
member.value: A that represents the copyright information for the media object.
member.remarks: If the media is operating under a Creative Commons license, a Creative Commons extension should be used instead.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.IYahooMediaCommonObjectEntities.Credits
member.summary: Gets the entities that contributed to the creation of the media object.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent the entities that contributed to the creation of the media object. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: Current entities can include people, companies, locations, etc. Specific entities can have multiple roles, and several entities can have the same role. These should appear as distinct entities.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.IYahooMediaCommonObjectEntities.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the media object.
member.value: A that represents a short description of the media object.
member.remarks: Media object descriptions are typically a sentence in length.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.IYahooMediaCommonObjectEntities.Hashes
member.summary: Gets the hash digests for the media object.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent the hash digests for the media object. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: When assigning multiple hashes, each must have a different .

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.IYahooMediaCommonObjectEntities.Keywords
member.summary: Gets the relevant keywords that describe the media object.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent the relevant keywords that describe the media object. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: Media objects are typically assigned maximum of ten keywords or phrases.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.IYahooMediaCommonObjectEntities.Player
member.summary: Gets or sets a web browser media player console the media object can be accessed through.
member.value: A that represents a web browser media player console the media object can be accessed through.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.IYahooMediaCommonObjectEntities.Ratings
member.summary: Gets the permissible audiences for the media object.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent the permissible audiences for the media object. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: If there are no ratings specified, it can be assumed that no restrictions are necessary.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.IYahooMediaCommonObjectEntities.Restrictions
member.summary: Gets the restrictions to be placed on aggregators that are rendering the media object.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent restrictions to be placed on aggregators that are rendering the media object. The default value is an empty collection.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.IYahooMediaCommonObjectEntities.TextSeries
member.summary: Gets the text transcript, closed captioning, or lyrics for the media object.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent text transcript, closed captioning, or lyrics for the media object. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: Many of these objects are permitted to provide a time series of text. In such cases, it is encouraged, but not required, that the objects be grouped by language and appear in time sequence order based on the start time. objects can have overlapping start and end times.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.IYahooMediaCommonObjectEntities.Thumbnails
member.summary: Gets the representative images for the media object.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent images that are representative of the media object. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: If multiple thumbnails are included, and time coding is not at play, it is assumed that the images are in order of importance.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaSyndicationExtensionContext.Categories
member.summary: Gets a taxonomy that gives an indication of the type of content for this syndication entity.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent a taxonomy that gives an indication to the type of content for this syndication entity. The default value is an empty collection.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaSyndicationExtensionContext.Copyright
member.summary: Gets or sets the copyright information for this syndication entity.
member.value: A that represents the copyright information for this syndication entity.
member.remarks: If the media is operating under a Creative Commons license, a Creative Commons extension should be used instead.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaSyndicationExtensionContext.Credits
member.summary: Gets the entities that contributed to the creation of this syndication entity.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent the entities that contributed to the creation of this syndication entity. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: Current entities can include people, companies, locations, etc. Specific entities can have multiple roles, and several entities can have the same role. These should appear as distinct entities.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaSyndicationExtensionContext.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of this syndication entity.
member.value: A that represents a short description of this syndication entity.
member.remarks: Media object descriptions are typically a sentence in length.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaSyndicationExtensionContext.Hashes
member.summary: Gets the hash digests for this syndication entity.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent the hash digests for this syndication entity. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: When assigning multiple hashes, each must have a different .

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaSyndicationExtensionContext.Keywords
member.summary: Gets the relevant keywords that describe this syndication entity.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent the relevant keywords that describe this syndication entity. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: Media objects are typically assigned maximum of ten keywords or phrases.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaSyndicationExtensionContext.Player
member.summary: Gets or sets a web browser media player console this syndication entity can be accessed through.
member.value: A that represents a web browser media player console this syndication entity can be accessed through.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaSyndicationExtensionContext.Ratings
member.summary: Gets the permissible audiences for this syndication entity.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent the permissible audiences for this syndication entity. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: If there are no ratings specified, it can be assumed that no restrictions are necessary.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaSyndicationExtensionContext.Restrictions
member.summary: Gets the restrictions to be placed on aggregators that are rendering this syndication entity.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent restrictions to be placed on aggregators that are rendering this syndication entity. The default value is an empty collection.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaSyndicationExtensionContext.TextSeries
member.summary: Gets the text transcript, closed captioning, or lyrics for this syndication entity.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent text transcript, closed captioning, or lyrics for this syndication entity. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: Many of these objects are permitted to provide a time series of text. In such cases, it is encouraged, but not required, that the objects be grouped by language and appear in time sequence order based on the start time. objects can have overlapping start and end times.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaSyndicationExtensionContext.Thumbnails
member.summary: Gets the representative images for this syndication entity.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent images that are representative of this syndication entity. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: If multiple thumbnails are included, and time coding is not at play, it is assumed that the images are in order of importance.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaSyndicationExtensionContext.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of this syndication entity.
member.value: A that represents the title of this syndication entity.

member.summary: Gets or sets the summary of the resource.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.AccessRights
member.summary: Gets or sets information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status.
member.value: Information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status.

remarks.para: may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies.

The property represents a statement about the intellectual property rights (IPR) held in or over a resource, a legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource, or a statement about access rights.
The resource described by this term is an instance of http://purl.org/dc/terms/RightsStatement. See http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#classes-RightsStatement for further information.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.AccrualMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the method by which items are added to a collection.
member.value: The method by which items are added to a collection.

remarks.para: The property represents the method by which resources are added to a collection.
The resource described by this term is an instance of http://purl.org/dc/terms/MethodOfAccrual. See http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#classes-MethodOfAccrual for further information.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.AccrualPeriodicity
member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency with which items are added to a collection.
member.value: The frequency with which items are added to a collection.

remarks.para: The property represents the rate at which something recurs.
The resource described by this term is an instance of http://purl.org/dc/terms/Frequency. See http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#classes-Frequency for further information.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.AccrualPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets thepolicy governing the addition of items to a collection.
member.value: The policy governing the addition of items to a collection.

remarks.para: The property represents the plan or course of action by an authority, intended to influence and determine decisions, actions, and other matters.
The resource described by this term is an instance of http://purl.org/dc/terms/Policy. See http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#classes-Policy for further information.

member.summary: Gets or sets the alternative name for the resource.
member.value: The alternative name for the resource.
member.remarks: The distinction between titles and alternative titles is application-specific.

member.value: The class of entity for whom the resource is intended or useful.

remarks.para: The property represents a group of resources that act or have the power to act.
The resource described by this term is an instance of http://purl.org/dc/terms/AgentClass. See http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#classes-AgentClass for further information.

member.value: The class of entity, defined in terms of progression through an educational or training context, for which the described resource is intended.

remarks.para: The property represents a group of resources that act or have the power to act.

member.summary: Gets or sets the bibliographic reference for the resource.
member.value: The bibliographic reference for the resource.
member.remarks: Recommended practice is to include sufficient bibliographic detail to identify the resource as unambiguously as possible.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.ConformsTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the established standard to which the described resource conforms.
member.value: The established standard to which the described resource conforms.

remarks.para: The property represents a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated.
The resource described by this term is an instance of http://purl.org/dc/terms/Standard. See http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#classes-Standard for further information.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.Contributor
member.summary: Gets or sets the entity responsible for making contributions to the resource.
member.value: The entity responsible for making contributions to the resource.

remarks.para: The property represents a resource that acts or has the power to act.
The resource described by this term is an instance of http://purl.org/dc/terms/Agent. See http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#classes-Agent for further information.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.Coverage
member.summary: Gets or sets the spatial or temporal topic of the resource, the spatial applicability of the resource, or the jurisdiction under which the resource is relevant.
member.value: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource, the spatial applicability of the resource, or the jurisdiction under which the resource is relevant.

remarks.para: Spatial topic and spatial applicability may be a named place or a location specified by its geographic coordinates. Temporal topic may be a named period, date, or date range. A jurisdiction may be a named administrative entity or a geographic place to which the resource applies. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Where appropriate, named places or time periods can be used in preference to numeric identifiers such as sets of coordinates or date ranges.
The property represents a location, period of time, or jurisdiction.

The resource described by this term is an instance of http://purl.org/dc/terms/LocationPeriodOrJurisdiction. See http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#classes-LocationPeriodOrJurisdiction for further information.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.Creator
member.summary: Gets or sets the entity primarily responsible for making the resource.
member.value: The entity primarily responsible for making the resource.

remarks.para: Examples of a include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a should be used to indicate the entity.
The property represents a resource that acts or has the power to act.
The resource described by this term is an instance of http://purl.org/dc/terms/Agent. See http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#classes-Agent for further information.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets a point or period of time associated with an event in the lifecycle of the resource.
member.value: A that indicates a point or period of time associated with an event in the lifecycle of the resource. The default value is , which indicates that no date was provided.
member.remarks: Date may be used to express temporal information at any level of granularity. The should be provided in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.DateAccepted
member.summary: Gets or sets the date of acceptance of the resource.
member.value: A that indicates the acceptance date of the resource. The default value is , which indicates that no acceptance date was provided.

remarks.para: The should be provided in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
Examples of resources to which a Date Accepted may be relevant are a thesis (accepted by a university department) or an article (accepted by a journal).

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.DateAvailable
member.summary: Gets or sets the date that the resource became or will become available.
member.value: The date (often a range) that the resource became or will become available.
member.remarks: When representing a date-time, it is recommended that the RFC #3339: Date and Time on the Internet (Timestamps) format is used. The value of this property can represent either a single date-time that indicates the period in time the resource became available, or it may represent a delimited date range that indicates the start and end dates that the resource is or will be available.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.DateCopyrighted
member.summary: Gets or sets the date of copyright of the resource.
member.value: A that indicates the copyright date of the resource. The default value is , which indicates that no copyright date was provided.

remarks.para: The should be provided in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.DateCreated
member.summary: Gets or sets the date of creation of the resource.
member.value: A that indicates creation date of the resource. The default value is , which indicates that no creation date was provided.
member.remarks: The should be provided in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.DateIssued
member.summary: Gets or sets the date of issuance of the resource.
member.value: A that indicates the formal issuance (e.g., publication) date of the resource. The default value is , which indicates that no issuance date was provided.
member.remarks: The should be provided in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.DateModified
member.summary: Gets or sets the date on which the resource was changed.
member.value: A that indicates the date on which the resource was changed. The default value is , which indicates that no modification date was provided.
member.remarks: The should be provided in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.DateSubmitted
member.summary: Gets or sets the date of submission of the resource.
member.value: A that indicates the submission date of the resource. The default value is , which indicates that no submission date was provided.

remarks.para: The should be provided in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
Examples of resources to which a Date Submitted may be relevant are a thesis (accepted by a university department) or an article (accepted by a journal).

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.DateValid
member.summary: Gets or sets the date that the resource is valid for.
member.value: The date (often a range) of validity of a resource.
member.remarks: When representing a date-time, it is recommended that the RFC #3339: Date and Time on the Internet (Timestamps) format is used. The value of this property can represent either a single date-time that indicates the period in time the resource is valid, or it may represent a delimited date range that indicates the start and end dates that the resource is or will be valid.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets an account of the resource.
member.value: An account of the resource.
member.remarks: may include but is not limited to: an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.Extent
member.summary: Gets or sets the size or duration of the resource.
member.value: The size or duration of the resource.

remarks.para: Examples include a number of pages, a specification of length, width, and breadth, or a period in hours, minutes, and seconds.
The property represents a dimension or extent, or a time taken to play or execute.
The resource described by this term is an instance of http://purl.org/dc/terms/SizeOrDuration. See http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#classes-SizeOrDuration for further information.

member.value: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource.

The property represents a media type or extent.
The resource described by this term is an instance of http://purl.org/dc/terms/MediaTypeOrExtent. See http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#classes-MediaTypeOrExtent for further information.

member.value: A related resource that is required by the described resource to support its function, delivery, or coherence.

remarks.para: This term is intended to be used with non-literal values as defined in the DCMI Abstract Model.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.Rights
member.summary: Gets or sets information about rights held in and over the resource.
member.value: Information about rights held in and over the resource.

remarks.para: Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights.

The property represents a statement about the intellectual property rights (IPR) held in or over a resource, a legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource, or a statement about access rights.
The resource described by this term is an instance of http://purl.org/dc/terms/RightsStatement. See http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#classes-RightsStatement for further information.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.RightsHolder
member.summary: Gets or sets the person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.
member.value: The person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.

remarks.para: The property represents a resource that acts or has the power to act.
The resource described by this term is an instance of http://purl.org/dc/terms/Agent. See http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#classes-Agent for further information.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets a related resource from which the described resource is derived.
member.value: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.

remarks.para: The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Recommended best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.
This term is intended to be used with non-literal values as defined in the DCMI Abstract Model.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.SpatialCoverage
member.summary: Gets or sets the spatial characteristics of the resource.
member.value: The spatial characteristics of the resource.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.Subject
member.summary: Gets or sets the topic of the resource.
member.value: The topic of the resource.

remarks.para: Typically, the subject will be represented using keywords, key phrases, or classification codes. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. To describe the spatial or temporal topic of the resource, use the property.
This term is intended to be used with non-literal values as defined in the DCMI Abstract Model.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreMetadataTermsSyndicationExtensionContext.TypeVocabulary
member.summary: Gets or sets the nature or genre of the resource.
member.value: An enumeration value that represents the nature or genre of the resource. The default value is , which indicates that no nature or genre was specified.

remarks.para: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the DCMI Type Vocabulary. This framework conforms to this best practice by providing the enumeration for specifiying the nature or genre of a resource.
To describe the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource, use the property.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.DublinCoreElementSetSyndicationExtensionContext.Coverage
member.summary: Gets or sets the spatial or temporal topic of the resource, the spatial applicability of the resource, or the jurisdiction under which the resource is relevant.
member.value: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource, the spatial applicability of the resource, or the jurisdiction under which the resource is relevant.

remarks.para: Spatial topic and spatial applicability may be a named place or a location specified by its geographic coordinates. Temporal topic may be a named period, date, or date range. A jurisdiction may be a named administrative entity or a geographic place to which the resource applies.

Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Where appropriate, named places or time periods can be used in preference to numeric identifiers such as sets of coordinates or date ranges.

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.FeedSynchronizationSyndicationExtension
member.summary: Extends syndication specifications to enable loosely-cooperating applications to use feeds as the basis for item sharing; the bi-directional, asynchronous synchronization of new and changed items amongst two or more cross-subscribed feeds.

remarks.para: The extends syndicated content to specify the minimum extensions necessary to enable loosely-cooperating applications to use Atom and RSS feeds as the basis for item sharing. This syndication extension conforms to the FeedSync for Atom and RSS 1.0 specification, which can be found at http://dev.live.com/feedsync/spec/.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaGroup.Credits
member.summary: Gets the entities that contributed to the creation of this media group.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent the entities that contributed to the creation of this media group. The default value is an empty collection.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaGroup.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of this media group.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaGroup.Keywords
member.summary: Gets the relevant keywords that describe this media group.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent the relevant keywords that describe this media group. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: Media objects are typically assigned maximum of ten keywords or phrases.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaGroup.Player
member.summary: Gets or sets a web browser media player console this media group can be accessed through.
member.value: A that represents a web browser media player console this media group can be accessed through.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaGroup.Ratings
member.summary: Gets the permissible audiences for this media group.

member.remarks: If there are no ratings specified, it can be assumed that no restrictions are necessary.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaGroup.Restrictions
member.summary: Gets the restrictions to be placed on aggregators that are rendering this media group.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent restrictions to be placed on aggregators that are rendering this media group. The default value is an empty collection.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaGroup.TextSeries
member.summary: Gets the text transcript, closed captioning, or lyrics for this media group.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent text transcript, closed captioning, or lyrics for this media group. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: Many of these objects are permitted to provide a time series of text. In such cases, it is encouraged, but not required, that the objects be grouped by language and appear in time sequence order based on the start time. objects can have overlapping start and end times.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaGroup.Thumbnails
member.summary: Gets the representative images for this media group.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent images that are representative of this media group. The default value is an empty collection.
member.remarks: If multiple thumbnails are included, and time coding is not at play, it is assumed that the images are in order of importance.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaGroup.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of this media group.
member.value: A that represents the title of this media group.

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.WellFormedWebCommentsSyndicationExtension
member.summary: Extends syndication specifications to provide a means exposing comments made against feed content.

remarks.para: The extends syndicated content to specify the human and machine readable endpoints for users to provide commentary on published content. This syndication extension conforms to the Well-Formed Web Comment API 1.0 specification, which can be found at http://wellformedweb.org/news/wfw_namespace_elements/.

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.SimpleListSort
member.summary: Represents information that enables the publisher to indicate to the client that the property to which it refers is one that is sortable, meaning that the client should provide a user interface that allows the user to sort on that property.

remarks.para: This informational entity makes reference to XML elements that are child-elements within the items of the same feed, using the supported extension mechanism of the feed format. This entity can also be used to provide a label for the default sort that appears in the list.

The value which is to be sorted must be the text content of the element itself (i.e. the character data contained in the element). Values of attributes or nested elements cannot be used for sorting. The property referred to must have no child-elements. In general, only one instance of a property should appear in each item. Clients are free to ignore repeated instances of properties.

member.summary: Gets or sets the information required for synchronization.
member.value: A object that represents the information required for synchronization.

remarks.para: This is required of all items in all feeds wishing to participate in FeedSync-based synchronization. Since is not required, feed consumers must consider the presence of in items or entries as an indication that the feed contains sync data.
It acceptable for a feed to have some items or entries with elements, and some without a . Only the items and entries that include the element participate in FeedSync synchronization.

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.FeedSynchronizationRelatedInformation
member.summary: Represents information about related feeds or locations.
member.remarks: In the case where a publishers feed has incorporated items from other feeds, it can be useful for subscribers to see more detailed information about the other feeds. In the case of feed sharing as envisioned by the FeedSync specification, this class can also be used to notify subscribing feeds of the feeds of other participants which they might also wish to subscribe to.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.FeedSynchronizationRelatedInformation.RelationType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the related feed.
member.value: A enumeration values that represents the type of the related feed. The default value is , which indicates that no relation type has been specified.

remarks.para: Publishers will generally include, in a feed, only the most recent modifications, additions, and deletions within some reasonable time window. These feeds are referred to as partial feeds, whereas feeds containing the complete set of items are referred to as complete feeds.

In the feed sharing context new subscribers, or existing subscribers failing to subscribe within the published feed window, will need to initially copy a complete set of items from a publisher before being in a position to process incremental updates. As such, the specification provides for the ability for the latter feed to reference the complete feed.

member.exception: The is equal to .

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.PingbackSyndicationExtension
member.summary: Extends syndication specifications to provide a means for publishers to request notification when an entity links to their content.

remarks.para: The extends syndicated content to specify a method for web authors to request notification when somebody links to one of their documents. This extension uses Pingback URLs in a such a way as to allow feed items to communicate the location of their Pingback server, as well as the value that should be passed as the targetURI when pinging. This syndication extension conforms to the Pingback Module for RSS 1.0/2.0 1.0 specification, which can be found at http://madskills.com/public/xml/rss/module/pingback/.

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.YahooMediaSyndicationExtension
member.summary: Extends syndication specifications to provide a means of supplementing the enclosure capabilities of feeds.

remarks.para: The extends syndicated content to extends enclosures to handle other media types, such as short films or TV, as well as provide additional metadata with the media. This extension enables content publishers and bloggers to syndicate multimedia content such as TV and video clips, movies, images, and audio.. This syndication extension conforms to the Media RSS Module 1.1.1 specification, which can be found at http://search.yahoo.com/mrss.

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.FeedHistorySyndicationExtension
member.summary: Extends syndication specifications to provide a means of publishing of entries across one or more feed documents.

remarks.para: The extends syndicated content to specify three types of syndicated Web feeds that enable publication of entries across one or more feed documents. This includes paged feeds for piecemeal access, archived feeds that allow reconstruction of the feed's contents, and feeds that are explicitly complete. This syndication extension conforms to the Feed Paging and Archiving 1.0 specification, which can be found at http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc5005.txt.

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.BasicGeocodingSyndicationExtension
member.summary: Extends syndication specifications to provide a means of representing latitude, longitude and other information about spatially-located things.

remarks.para: The extends syndicated content to specify a basic RDF vocabulary that provides the Semantic Web community with a namespace for representing latitude, longitude and other information about spatially-located things. This syndication extension conforms to the Basic Geo (WGS84 lat/long) Vocabulary specification, which can be found at http://www.w3.org/2003/01/geo/.

member.name: T:Argotic.Extensions.Core.FeedSynchronizationItem
member.summary: Represents the information required for synchronization of syndication feeds.

remarks.para: The class represents a sx:sync element in the FeedSync specification.

This is required of all items in all feeds wishing to participate in FeedSync-based synchronization. Since is not required, feed consumers must consider the presence of in items or entries as an indication that the feed contains sync data.
It acceptable for a feed to have some items or entries with elements, and some without a . Only the items and entries that include the element participate in FeedSync synchronization.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.FeedSynchronizationItem.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the globally unique identifier for this item.
member.value: The globally unique identifier for this item.

remarks.para: The identifier must be globally unique within the feed and it must be identical across feeds if an item is being shared or synchronized as part of multiple distinct independent feeds.

Atom has a similar requirement for each entry to have a unique id. While the Atom entry id could be used for the sync id at the publishers discretion, implementers must not assume that the Atom id for the entry matches the sync id. Likewise, if the RSS item includes a guid, implementers must not assume that the guid is the same as the sync id.

In Atom feeds, it is acceptable to have multiple entries in the same feed with the same atom id element; in this case, the entries are considered different versions of the same entry. It is allowed to use FeedSync in such a feed, but the sx:sync/@id attributes are still required to be different in each entry. FeedSync considers those entries to be different sync items.

The identifier is assigned by the creator of the item, and must not be changed by subsequent publishers. Applications will collate and compare these identifiers; therefore they must conform to the syntax for Namespace Specific Strings (the NSS portion of a URN) in RFC 2141.

member.exception: The is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The is an empty string.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.FeedSynchronizationItem.ConflictPreservation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether conflict preservation is performed for this item.
member.value: A enumeration value that indicates whether conflict preservation is performed for this item. The default value is , which indicates conflict preservation must be performed for the item.

remarks.para: This value must only be set once, and shall only be set when the updates property value is 1. All updates to the item after the first update must propagate whatever state was set on the first update.

Within this framework, is equivalent to true for the noconflicts attribute in the FeedSync specification, while is equivalent to false for the noconflicts attribute in the FeedSync specification. Specifying a value of is equivalent to the noconflicts attribute not being present.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.FeedSynchronizationItem.TombstoneStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the item has been deleted.
member.value: A enumeration value that indicates whether this item has been deleted. The default value is , which indicates the item has not been deleted.

remarks.para: Within this framework, is equivalent to true for the deleted attribute in the FeedSync specification, while is equivalent to false for the deleted attribute in the FeedSync specification. Specifying a value of is equivalent to the deleted attribute not being present.

member.name: P:Argotic.Extensions.Core.FeedSynchronizationItem.Updates
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of updates applied to this item.
member.value: The number of updates applied to this item. The default value is 1.
member.exception: The is less than 1.
